page.title: 02The Brent Knoll
page.content:
Brent Knoll is the most important feature in the area and the only high ground. It used to be owned privately but is now owned by the National Trust. It was once surrounded by water and known as the Isle of Frogs.
Brent Knoll was once used by the Romans and also in the Iron Age as a fort. The outline of the ramparts and defences of the fort are still clearly visible.
Today it is used for grazing cattle and sheep. There are several footpaths leading to the top. A narrow lane goes over the hill between East Brent and Brent Knoll. A flag is flown on the top during Harvest Home Celebrations.
